commentBody: I understand the importance of acceptance and equality in the workplace and how the world needs to accept people for who they are, but this attempt to exalt a pro ref for "self- identifying" as opposed to coming out because it somehow has more meaning is Soooo weak.  Let's be honest; the only reason he said anything is because he was "called out" in a terrible way on national tv which provided him the perfect platform to "self- identify".  So please, give me a break.  Put yourself out front first, before you're called out by a jerk like Rondo, and then the distinction between "coming out" and "self- identifying" might have some meaning.  Otherwise you're just making something out of nothing...

replies.commentBody: "called out" is one of the most imprecise yet self-aggrandizing phrases out there.
"Put yourself out front first..."  But that is not in some folks' nature.  Some people don't want to be "out front" and the fact that some of those people are gay shouldn't force them to be.

Talk about making something out of nothing. Kennedy chose to do what he did the way he did it. The author recognized in this action something he considered brave for a reason. It means something to you. If it means nothing to you, that's not his concern.
